context: Dermal equivalent viability was plotted vs. the calculated C c. The EC50 was determined using non-linear regression analysis (SigmaPlot, SPSS Science, Chicago, IL) of viability curves from three independent experiments.Statistical analysis Data were expressed as mean±SEM. The one-way ANOVA and t-test (Statistica, Statsoft, Tulsa, OK) were used for data analysis. The effect of time or different m-xylene concentrations on partition coefficient determination was compared using the one-way ANOVA. The t-test compared changes in m-xylene concentration in sealed exposure vials at 0.08 or 4 h with the 0-h samples. P<0.05 was used as the level for significance. Media concentrations of m-xylene Measurements of m-xylene concentration in unsealed 24- and 48-well culture plates showed a temporal decrease in the exposure medium m-xylene concentration (Fig. 3 ).
